q: Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.
h:
“Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
h:
“Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.
h:
“If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.
h:
“Freedom is the only worthy goal in life. It is won by disregarding things that lie beyond our control.” —
Epictetus

q: Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.
h:
“Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.
h:
“The truth... It is a beautiful and terrible thing, and should therefore be treated with great caution.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.
h:
“The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience.” —
Mark Manson

q: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
h:
“Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.” —
Richard Bach

q: Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
h:
“Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.
h:
“Once a decision was made, I didn't worry about it afterward.” —
Harry S. Truman
